abstract: Stocks fell Thursday, with the Dow Jones industrial average losing nearly 200 points, as investors were hit by a series of bleak economic reports that signaled further problems for exports and the labor market, The New York Times’s Michael M. Grybaum reported.
lead_paragraph: Stocks fell Thursday, with the Dow Jones industrial average losing nearly 200 points, as investors were hit by a series of bleak economic reports that signaled further problems for exports and the labor market, The New York Times’s Michael M. Grybaum reported.

headline.main: After Bleak Export and Labor News, Stocks Fall More Than 2%
